div:
Note that the terminologies included in this implementation guide contain point-in-time expansions, as of the date of publication in the ValueSet resources. Before use in a production environment, ensure you have the latest expansions based on the definitions for each value set.
The following terminology artifacts have been defined for the CDC 2022 Opioid Prescribing Guideline implementation guide:
CodeSystems {% include list-simple-codesystems.xhtml %}
ValueSets
Benzodiazepine medications
Buprenorphine and methadone medications
CDC malignant cancer conditions
Condition Clinical Status Active
Condition Category Encounter Diagnosis
Condition Category Problem List
Condition Category US Core Health Concern
Conditions documenting substance misuse
Conditions likely terminal for opioid prescribing
Extended release opioid analgesics with ambulatory misuse potential
Fentanyl-type medications
Fentanyl-type urine drug screening tests
Limited life expectancy conditions
MedicationRequest Category Community
MedicationRequest Status Active
Naloxone medications
Non-opioid drug urine screening
Non-synthetic opioid medications
Observation Category Laboratory
Observation Category Procedure
Oncology specialty designations (NUCC)
Opioid analgesics with ambulatory misuse potential
Opioid counseling procedure
Opioid drug urine screening
Opioid misuse assessment procedure
Opioid misuse disorders
Pain management procedure
Pain treatment plan
PDMP data reviewed finding
PDMP review procedure
Substance misuse behavioral counseling
Therapies indicating end of life care
Individual tests and panels of tests of urine for drugs of misuse
Office visit
Action Indicators
Hospice Disposition
Hospice Observation Finding
Hospice Procedure/Request
